apollo.datasets.loaders.nam.NamLoader¶

class apollo.datasets.loaders.nam.NamLoader(cache_dir='./data/NAM-NMM', fail_fast=False, save_nc=True, keep_gribs=False)[source]¶

A class to download, subsets, and cache NAM forecasts.

A NamLoader downloads NAM-NMM forecasts from NOAA, subsets their features and geographic scope, converts the data to netCDF, and caches the result.

__init__(cache_dir='./data/NAM-NMM', fail_fast=False, save_nc=True, keep_gribs=False)[source]¶

Creates a loader for NAM data.

Parameters:
  • cache_dir (pathlib.Path or str) – The path to the cache.
  • fail_fast (bool) – If true, the download errors are treated as fatal. Otherwise downloads are retried with exponential backoff. This overrides the max_tries argument of the download method.
  • save_nc (bool) – Convert the dataset to netCDF on disk.
  • keep_gribs (bool) – Keep the GRIB files after converting to netCDF.

Methods

exception CacheMiss[source]¶
download(reftime, forecast, max_tries=8, timeout=10)[source]¶

Ensure that the GRIB for this reftime and forecast exists locally.

Parameters:
  • reftime (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference time to download.
  • forecast (int) – The forecast hour to download
  • max_tries (int) – The maximum number of failed downloads for a single file before raising an IOError. This option is ignored if fail_fast is set on the NamLoader.
  • timeout (int) – The network timeout in seconds. Note that the government servers can be kinda slow.
grib_path(reftime, forecast)[source]¶

The path for a forecast GRIB.

Parameters:
  • reftime (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference time.
  • forecast (int) – The forecast hour.
Returns:

pathlib.Path – The local path for a GRIB file, which may not exist.
grib_url(reftime, forecast)[source]¶

The URL for a specific forecast.

Parameters:
  • reftime (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference time.
  • forecast (int) – The forecast hour.
Returns:

str – A URL to a GRIB file.
load_grib(reftime, forecast)[source]¶

Load a forecast from GRIB.

This is where the bulk of the dataset normalization happens.

Parameters:
  • reftime (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference time.
  • forecast (int) – The forecast hour.
Returns:

xarray.Dataset – A dataset containing the contents of the GRIB.
nc_path(reftime)[source]¶

The path to the netCDF cache for a reference time.

Parameters:reftime (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference time.
Returns:pathlib.Path – The local path to a netCDF file, which may not exist.
open(*reftimes)[source]¶

Load and combine forecasts for some reference times, downloading and preprocessing GRIBs as necessary.

If the dataset exists as a local netCDF file, it is loaded and returned. Otherwise, any missing GRIB files are downloaded and preprocessed into an xarray Dataset. The dataset is then saved as a netCDF file, the GRIBs are deleted, and the dataset is returned.

Parameters:reftimes (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference times to open.
Returns:xarray.Dataset – A single dataset containing all forecasts at the given reference times. Some data may be dropped when combining forecasts.
open_gribs(reftime='now')[source]¶

Load the forecasts from GRIB, downlading if they do not exist.

Parameters:reftime (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference time to open.
Returns:xarray.Dataset – A dataset for the forecast at this reftime.
open_nc(reftime='now')[source]¶

Load the forecasts from a netCDF in the cache.

Parameters:reftime (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The reference time to open.
Returns:xarray.Dataset – A dataset for the forecast at this reftime.
open_range(start='2017-01-01', stop='today')[source]¶

Load and combine forecasts for a range of reference times.

NOTE: This method only loads data from the cache.

Parameters:
  • start (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The first time in the range. The default is 2017-01-01T00:00
  • stop (numpy.datetime64 or str) – The last time in the range. The default is the start of the current day.
Returns:

xarray.Dataset – A single dataset containing all forecasts at the given reference times. Some data may be dropped when combining forecasts.
